Low pay, low housing discount, low bonus structure and pay per lease, split days off that lead to extreme burnout, zero work life balance, having to come in on your day off for some ridiculous meeting, overworked, understaffed, aggressive and very needy residents, I could go on and barely scratch the tip of the iceberg. Favoritism ran rampant at the property I was at and I truly felt like I did not matter, nor did anything I did for the company as I was barely spoken to most days, ostracized on a daily basis, constantly left alone in the office whilst my manager would socialize with the favorites in their office day after day. pros: Pro 1- Ability to work with ease under management. Management is awesome, company wide, not just in one particular area or city. They don't just say that, they are encouraging and will assist you with advancing your career goals within their company as there are many options to grow and diversify. That pertains to rookies and experienced industries leaders alike at this company. If you want to grow, you can and will here. Pro 3- EXCELLENT 'work --life balance' here. This makes ALL the difference, as us hard-working and diligent American's know- we are worked to the bone and having an occupation with a healthy work /life balance is near impossible to find these days, especially in starting with a new company. That is a non-issue at Avalonbay and in my opinion/experience ---can even outweigh salary in some situations because of the substantial value that holds in our busy lives. They do not deny you of that, are very open to time off, vacations, etc and a schedule that fits your needs. You will never feel overtaken by work in your personal life, I appreciated that immensely.
cons: Con 1- In leasing, you will have a 'down' season, of course, as well as an 'up' season meaning you will make more money during particular points in the year and less at other times, it will not always be consistent. There are huge advantages to leasing online during the down times as well as multiple marketing options to keeps your sales rolling in, however it is something to consider. Con 2- Weekends are best times to lease, that's when people are shopping for homes/apartments, so sacrificing some time on the weekends would be in your best interest if you want take advantage of those primo days to sell. Con 3- Unfortunately they are one of the many companies that have not got the memo--"your relentless and ongoing meetings are not neccessary and take away from productivity." I think we all have these complaints regarding the endless amount of meetings we attend in the work force and typically day dream through, while panicking at the same time having your work sit on your desk unattended. This you will still find to be the case, even having to travel occasionally to do so. However, you are compensated for travel accordingly, and when I say accordingly, I mean as employees should be compensated(not just the bare minimum), which is rare and appreciated. title: Rare Combination of Long-Term View and Strong Values
pros: AVB is unique in the real estate industry in that they develop a majority of the buildings they own (as opposed to buying them from a 3rd party), and as a REIT, they are incentivized to hold these properties long-term (10+ years). This combination allows the firm to focus on "doing the right thing" and building quality apartments that don't cut corners. The focus on yield vs. merchant builders focus on IRR allows more thoughtful and socially responsible development. There is a strong emphasis on hiring good people with good reputation which has built a strong culture at the firm from the top down. Hiring process filters out toxic personalities - "no a**holes" Pay is reasonable and the firm emphasizes growth from within, although teams run lean and are scattered around the country so lateral moves are limited without relocation. 20% discount on rent at AVB properties which can be a meaningful bonus.
cons: From a development perspective, AVB is a big, publicly traded REIT so there is limited exposure to deals / structures outside of wheelhouse. Most every deal will be a fee-simple, 100+ apartment building with no outside partners, equity or financing. As a vertically integrated firm construction and management are in-house so you have great visibility but less opportunity to build relationships outside the firm and negotiate capital stacks, etc.

Very good work/life balance. Average in terms of time off policies, but it's not looked down upon when you do use your time.
cons: Compensation has changed several times without much notice - so far not for the better. People do get promoted from within but only to those who are willing to take on the functional role of the higher position they are seeking indefinitely, in hopes that an official spot will open up. This is more so for lower level positions until you hit a bottleneck. No pay transparency, so those who are promoted are given low ball offers. At times, Community Consultants are treated more like receptionists and administrative assistants than leasing agents.

title: Good Culture, not the best pay
pros: The company has great culture and you do learn a lot. The first Community Manager that I worked with was amazing! Always hands on and no work was beneath her title. Every office that I have worked in has felt like family. Everyone is really nice for the most part.
cons: They literally pay less then every Property management company that I have researched. The discount is also a lot less than most companies. The work load is heavy for what you make and recently CC's have had to worry about maintaining response times that sometimes are unobtainable when you have residents who need your undivided attention.

title: Avalon puts as much effort into employee satisfaction as they do the customer. (that's rare!)
pros: From the office environment to benefits, AvalonBay is top notch. Most companies exert the most effort in marketing & PR, customer satisfaction and of course profit & loss. Avalon does too, but takes it a step further by ensuring the employee is happy and has everything he/she needs to grow and succeed in their position. People above and around me, with more experience, go out of their way on a regular basis to assist me as I learn my way. My work is hard, it is stressful and at times chaotic, but I never wake up in the morning and think "I hate my job". I made a career change to be here, and left a miserable work life behind me. I have ZERO regrets and I'm thankful I stumbled upon AvalonBay.
cons: More extensive training, possibly a online course/tutorial, for the new database software. It took me quite a while to settle in.

title: manager track from day one as a consultant
pros: -competitive industry salary -positive growth since the start -great training -national opportunities for relocation available but difficult to attain
cons: -too many systems -too many rules- ie- if this than that or... -pay raises are low -really have to keep head down to standout for promotions -lots of young entry level staff causing on site tension -We can all complain about being underpaid. Focus on the work that you do and put aside inapplicable job experience when negotiating salary because that's how they look at it. If you have a degree in physics and apply for a job in sales, sorry that doesn't apply to a position not requiring a degree in the first place.

title: Infinite Gratitude - That's how I define AVB!
pros: When your employer is kind to all, includes you in their plans, future growth, quarterly and year-end company-wide communications. Listens to you and values your input. Gives you open opportunities to be inventive and cares about what you support. Says hello and shows their gratefulness for your contributions. These are just a few things that define infinite gratitude that is never ending here at AVB and opens up a world of possibilities and opportunities. I have worked in the multi-family housing industry for 20+ years and AVB is bar none the best! Benefits, competitive salary, growth and innovation.
cons: Like with any company who continues to grow to keep up with times and latest technology (i.e. updating/changing out old systems to provide enhancements to the integration of business processes) comes challenges and new learning curves. Overtime with valuable feedback and collaboration from all teams makes for a faster, more efficient system and communication tool for all. As well as, a smoother transition for those new coming on board.

title: Warm, friendly family atmosphere where everyone is willing to help each other.
pros: Avalon offers opportunities for most associates to advance their status and pay through a structured curriculum (Career Atlas). An individual has to want to do better and take advantage of the program to be successful. Bonuses in Customer Service and other departments are also a great way to basically double your income monthly (performance based). When you do a GREAT job all around, you are rewarded.
cons: There really aren’t any if you lean on your own work ethic and drown out negativity. Be your own person and work smart. No reason why anyone can’t be successful unless they’re not putting forth the effort. Associates are doing it monthly, those who say it can’t be done aren’t fully applying themselves. If they redirect their energy, they will see different results!

title: Rotting From the Inside Out.
pros: A lot of free lunch.
cons: Recruiter was clueless during the interview process. HR was non-existent during the on-boarding process. Training focused solely on customer service skills and completely neglected the absurd amount of programs and day-to-day metrics that need to be constantly managed. Training classes felt like being in a kindergarten class. Free-for-all mentality with daily work led to mass confusion and terrible performance and management from veteran employees. No one knows what they're doing.Everyone from the top down. The blind leading the blind. Avalonbay is one big contradiction implementing AI whilst veteran employees are still posting paper to apartment doors like they're Martin Luther posting his 95 thesis. Everytime you think you have a grasp on something, they pull the rug out from under you and implement something totally new. The corporate team things they are the Vatican descending upon the masses everyone they show up on-site expecting everyone to bow down to their glory. The company is transparent, but presented like rocket science. You have to be Isaac Newton to understand the bonus plan. Everything is so convuluted at this company that you just have to bite your teeth and take whatever comes your way.

title: It's not what it looks like
pros: -It's a stable and secure job, especially for a pandemic. -You get to visit other properties and enjoy new spaces and views from where you don't always get a chance to. (depending on the property you work on) -Starting pay is okay/dissent compare to a minimum wage.
cons: -You realize you don't get paid enough to deal with a lot of flaws -you get a max of 2 weeks for a vacation after earning 80 hours of vacation. supposedly you can't cash out your vacation & sick time if you leave the company. and the max amount of vacation hours you can accumulate is around 280. -Other competitors seem to give you better deals (Based on my previous manager leaving after 10+ years working for them and another tech 3 leaving soon after) -Management has a lot of room for improvement

title: Human Resources
pros: I've worked with AVB for 7 years now. As a large corporation they provide the salary and benefits you would expect. The growth over the past 7 years has been extraordinary, however the company's ability to manage the growth by was incredible. I believe one of our core values; continuous improvement, played a key role in this process. The culture here is also very unique in an extremely positive way. Open communication is encouraged and built into our culture. For example, we will gather all of our associates who work in our communities together multiple times a year to have quarterly meetings as well as appreciation day events.
cons: Depending on the part of the organization you join, there may not be allot of levels to progress through. This is mostly true within the regional offices. With that said, there is always ample opportunity within your role to take on new experiences and grow your own skill sets to maintain and grow your marketability.

title: Community Consultant
pros: Overall a good company to work for, but honestly the pay became almost insulting. We are taught to act like owners and go over and beyond as consultants. An average community consultant at AVB is still better quality than most but I was not compensated as such. Team atmosphere and training was really a great focus compared to other PM companies I have been with.
cons: ultant

title: Customer Care Center only “cares” about its executive level officers
pros: I can’t think of a single pro to working here. When we were fully remote it was fine, but since returning to the office, it feels completely demoralizing to work for this company.
cons: Pay SUCKS. Workload is extreme. Understaffed. Zero flexibility for working remotely (despite the fact that we did it successfully for two years). They hire full-time remote workers in different states but don’t allow their current employees in the same job position to be remote, which honestly feels discriminatory and should be illegal. Old white men in the Arlington office make the decisions for our office and they don’t benefit us whatsoever. Completely out of touch with the wants and needs of their employees. Loyal and hardworking employees dropping like flies and management couldn't care less.

title: Happy employee
pros: Fast paced environment that allows day to go by quickly. Working at large properties allows higher income. Working at smaller properties allow steady income. If you are willing to learn and be proactive you can grow into supervisor roles. Recognition of employee results daily, monthly, quarterly. With all jobs if you don't enjoy it I'd say find new work if you don't like helping residents. 401k match, healt benefits, compensation for travel to help other communities.
cons: Initial training is based off of the strength of the current team. You are given web based training and allowed to follow employees to learn on the run. Some people I could see may struggle as everyone learns differently.

title: Fantastic Company and Fantastic Environment
pros: -Corporate culture - AVB ensures they hire talent that is not only knowledgeable, but also has the temperament that fits into our culture embodied in our core values. There is a strong sense of dedication to the mission, and everyone is just so pleasant to work with. -Leadership - AVB's middle to upper management are conscientious leaders who understand the importance of work life balance, and foster an environment that inhibits growth within the company. I've been with the company for nearly 4 years, and I've been promoted twice. They appreciate talent within the company and do their best to hang onto that talent. -Benefits - the benefits are wonderful, from holidays/vacation days, to sick days, to 401k plans, etc. - AVB does their best to ensure they take care of their employees. They even allow for paid time off to contribute to community service organizations, and AVB makes philanthropy an important priority. This is by far the best place I've ever worked.
cons: They aren't perfect, but then again, who is?

title: Great job, great company. Lots of changes in last year that have made me question our direction and my future.
pros: Love my job. Company has been very good to its associates in the past. My director is very engaged and a true mentor. Fellow associates are very good at their jobs and make coming to work worthwhile. Pay is competitive.
cons: Real change in management with the Archstone acquisition. Seems like upper mangement that joined last year cares less about associates. Very unfriendly and dismissive. Many former Archstone associates I have had dealt with have a holier than though attitude and refuse to be a part of the company. They would rather just change everything here to how they used to do things.

title: I am proud to work for AvalonBay Communities
pros: AvalonBay Communities is an amazing company that is full of opportunities and growth for those that are hungry for success. I've been working with Avalonbay for 4 years now and it was the best career decision I have ever made. I started as a Tech I and was developed into a Maintenance Supervisor. I am in the LA district and all of our directors are great leaders and teachers. The corporate team does a great job of showing us how they appreciate what we do for the company by constant communication and support, quality constructive feedback, and great associate quarterly award meetings. I'm extremely thankful for what I have learned with Avalonbay, it has guided me on a path I wouldn't change for anything. I know this progressive company is only going to grow and continue to be a lucrative career destination for positive hard working individuals.
cons: The computers could use an upgrade but I think that's on the way

title: Long time employee that has experienced the culture change
pros: I'm a ten year employee that was a huge advocate of Avalonbay. I was proud to work for this company. Avalon lives customer service with our residents and they took this same approach with associates. That has drastically changed.
cons: Avalonbay prides itself on inclusion and diversity but they do not practice what they preach. They implemented numerous operational changes during the pandemic. Our onsite teams showed up and ran our properties safely. We didn't have the luxury of sitting behind a keyboard working from home. We were told in late 2021 that we can no longer safely operate our communities unless we were vaccinated. Avalonbay received numerous exemption requests, I was told over 130 from HR including mine. The company denied almost all citing that they would create an undue hardship to the business from a financial standpoint. Employees are just a number and this is just a job.

title: Not worth the time or effort required.
pros: Will let you find out how patient you are very quickly.
cons: Management is a mess. People completely unqualified for their positions. Upper management is full of people making decisions about day to day operations when they have no idea what a normal offices day to day looks like. "Promotions" are a joke and so is the way the leasing agents get paid. You will need a degree in finance to understand your paycheck and good luck getting someone to explain it to you. The insurance you get isn't very good and finding doctors in network can be very challenging. Overall, for the amount of work you are expected to perform, the compensation makes the job frustrating at best. I would recommend looking else where for employment if you have the opportunity. Turn over rates are very high.

title: The Best Decision I Have Ever Made: Signing My Offer Letter
pros: AvalonBay is a strong believer in integrity, which is a difficult quality to come by in almost anything today. The company provides each and every single associate with the training tools necessary to succeed in his or her job. AvalonBay also offers a relocation program for its associates that need a little more flexibility if they travel/move often. With over 250 communities in the country, any associate is bound to find a place that best fits his or her needs.
cons: Although AvalonBay will never be the highest-paying property management company, it definitely takes care of its associates in ways that other companies could never provide.

title: Amazing Culture and Overall Employer
pros: Company culture is incredible, you work with people from top to bottom that care about and about their work. Good ability to earn money. Clear ways to grow personally and professionally and guidance as to the steps for advancement. Great work life balance and flexibility. The company has done a phenomenal job making sure we have information, resources, and a feeling of safety and job stability during the Covid-19 pandemic. Great benefits. I love working here!
cons: Bonus and compensation plans can change too often at times and sometimes they aren’t ideal. The company does course-correct and listen to feedback when people don’t like this though, I just wish it didn’t happen a few times during my tenure.

title: Amazing Company Review from a 2 month (so far) AvalonBay Employee
pros: On-boarding as a new employee is smooth and everyone is very welcoming, from facilities management personnel to upper management and immediate team members . Amazing, intelligent, and caring coworkers Management is extremely down to earth and understanding. Terrific benefits. Work is rewarding and very collaborative. Tons of company events, company truly wants you to have a work family. Interview process is long and thorough, but I can now see that this is to ensure employees fit within the company culture and have the drive to add true value to the company. If the company is a good fit, employees are more likely to have a happy work experience, and will therefore stay employed longer creating an even greater sense of a work family.
cons: No laptops unless you travel a lot, so no opportunity to telework, which could be helpful/beneficial at times. Technology is a little dated, but they are catching up.

title: Maintenance Supervisor
pros: I have been an proud Avalonbay employee for the last 8 years. I am amazed of how many friends and new contacts a have made over these years and more importantly Avalonbay provided me with the opportunity of growing not only in my career but as an individual. The company has a great culture and shows appreciation for its people and their effort. I witness promotions with in the company very often and the work environment is GREAT (internal joke :) I am very happy where I am at now and excited to see the grown of company along with mine and my co worker's.
cons: Being that this is the nature of the businesses, we can experience a lot of movement between properties due to property dispositions, new developments etc. That can be tough for some individuals, but it comes along with a lot of opportunities for advancement to those that are open to change and have some flexibility.

title: Management is a boys club
pros: The thing that I like the best is the people I work with and that every day is something new
cons: I will be honest and say I didn’t always feel like It was a boys club, but I’ve noticed something over the past few years and it’s that a number of women have been passed up for promotions on Long Island and given to men who are much less experienced and are much less qualified. If experienced females are being passed up for promotions why would any female who works around them think they will be able to move up in the company. Raises are not given unless you get promoted and the only way a qualified female is getting is if there are no males from the region applying for the same position.

title: A solid start
pros: If you're interested in getting into the Real Estate Industry, AVB will provide you a solid foundation for which you will be able to not only get your "foot in the door", but also to cultivate the necessary skills for future career growth. Daily operations are intersecting, allowing contact points with various departments. This allows for greater exposure towards different lines within the company teams. The active interactions across teams not only facilitates a greater involvement within the grander picture of property operations, but also intrigue. It will definitely peak your interest as to the possibilities available within the horizon of your developing professional journey.
cons: Residents and operations of properties differ from one Community to the next. You may find yourself at a property which you may not individual connect with, as a result of either of the former being more to demanding in their daily dealings.

title: This company is all about money; squeezing every dollar possible out of residents and working people into the ground.
pros: Great benefits. Big company with big resources.
cons: There is a tremendous effort put into making things "look good" to the stock holders. Associates are measured so tightly to adhere to every possible metric imaginable, that the work load is completely driven by "which team has the best numbers". The result is an exhausting work environment that feels like the leaders are trying to get blood from a stone & don't really care about associates or residents. Also, duplicitous behavior from some of the exec team; giving directives, then passing the buck when the result doesn't pan out in their favor so they did not take the heat. Very dissapointing experience.

title: Executive Assistant
pros: AVB is a great collaborative environment where everyone is respectful and honestly concerned with work / life balance. I believe we have the support we need to do a great job. I have worked at AVB for the past three years. I have welcomed and enjoyed new challenges. I love driving by an AvalonBay community. With great pride I can tell others "That's my company!"
cons: Only in about eight markets.

title: Unhappy with new bonus and pay cuts
pros: I can't think of any. I dedicated 5 years to this company to get one promotion. Our titles were assistant manager then change to customer service supervisor to sales and service supervisor essentially all the same job description but with the new bonus structure we went from getting paid in the mid $20s to less the $20 an hour. A 12% pay cut for all employees.
cons: New bonus structure is horrible. Level of stress has risen and it feels like we have become pushy to close leases. 12% pay cut was upsetting and more insulting is they want us to believe we can potentially make more if we hit sales goals. Sales goals are too high so I've missed goal 3 months in a row and taxed on bonuses. Associate housing treats us worse then regular residents. I'm working more, stressing more and getting paid less.

title: Very grateful to work in AVB!
pros: I was hired by AVB 3 months ago, though I heard many positive points about company in general while i was working in another competitor company, but now in this short period of time I can say, that I'm truly enjoying my work and friendships in a peaceful and non stressful atmosphere. Me and my wife are so happy to have a job that is a family oriented and full of great benefits. Though I was hired with a less pay wage than I was making before, but honestly, both me and my wife feel much blessed and stress free than in my former job. So, we are very thankful for this company and people who work in here! I can't think of any cons at the moment and hope I don't need to think about it even later.
cons: I can not think of about any thing, that does not satisfy my work ethics.

title: Company values are not just talking points.
pros: Having worked with companies both large and small over a thirty year career; it could be said that I have a solid base of comparison regarding company values and culture. If I were to rate the different companies I have worked for; It would be safe to say that AvalonBay is at the top of the list for the value they place on and the respect given to their associates. I have worked for both the West and East coast regions at AvalonBay and the family/ team culture was equally displayed in both regions. Additionally, AvalonBay has one of the best onboarding processes I have experienced. The instruction in the areas of safety and company culture were especially impressive. By far the finest aspect of the culture however; they live the company values. They are not just talking points.
cons: Silos dividing the various departments.

title: Customer Service
pros: I am allowed to work with a male who has been written up several times over the past few years for sexual harassment. And he is held up by management as a shining example of what each person should strive to be.
cons: Same as the cons. So a word to the wise.... and I have witnessed this.... this same male who has been written up for sexual harassment has more complaints covered up by management. I am waiting for someone to really get mad and sue the company. As it is an open secret that he does this and has been for years. I have only worked here for a little over a year, but I have heard him, seen his emails to other associates, and yet the upper management still manage to keep him employed.

title: Great company!
pros: Decent benefits, including 401k matching and housing discount for associates. Great coworkers and managers, and fantastic management practice. Everyone truly supports the core values of our company, and upper management does its best to treat it's employees well. There are structures in place to protect employees from retaliation and overall is an ethical company.
cons: Benefits could be better, cannot afford to live in our communities even with a discount. This is primarily a sales/customer service job, which, while it pays the bills, is not mentally stimulating enough for me. Appears difficult to get out of entry-level positions.

title: RS politics - not what it use to be
pros: get paid to work no protection for maintenance staff
cons: Maintenance the face of the company who work through covid all day everyday gets the worst treatment and doesn't get the same growth opportunities. they dont list job posting internal nor externally. they treat minority as if we are not as smart and over work us then demote us. the majority will have the same job make worst mistakes and not get reprimanded. some of these guys go along and make their own rules.

title: Unmatchable!!!
pros: Supportive structure with Sr management who truly care about the people who work here. Room for advancement if you work hard...Avalon loves to promote from within! Great benefits. Good work/life balance. Just an amazing place to work. I have been here almost 15 years, and nothing is the same (except Lotus Notes..lol). Very forward thinking company who solicited associate feedback to improve operations. Love, love, love this company!
cons: The pay and bonuses are not up to par with the industry. It is not completely far off, but all of the other benefits you get while working here far outweigh the difference.

title: One of the best companies I have worked for!
pros: Avalonbay has a great culture and team members feel appreciated and rewarded which is important to keep moral and productivity going. I feel supported by upper management, but also have the freedom to make decisions that suit the resident, property and company. I'm also grateful for our Customer Care Center which handles billing and lots of the back of the house items. It gives the on-site teams more time to engage and service residents. I also finally(!) have work/ life balance which I did not have at other property management companies. I LOVE working for Avalonbay!
cons: While I appreciate the employee discount on apartments that is offered, I feel Managers or Supervisors should receive a dedicated apartment, as it's important to have a staff member from the leasing office also live on site, not just maintenance who does receive a dedicated apartment.

title: Great place to work!
pros: After working for a much larger company where you get lost in the mix, it is comforting to work somewhere associates know your name, know what you can contribute and trust in your work. It is not uncommon for upper management, including the CFO to ask you (by name) how you are doing and know things about your family. AvalonBay cultivates a team environment where different departments work together to achieve the company goals. No matter the level, associates are not afraid to jump in, roll their sleeves up and assist each other. So many great things to say!
cons: On the flipside, with a smaller company, there is not always a "department" to handle every situation that comes up. The positive of that is you learn to wear many different hats!

title: Pretty Good
pros: Its very nice job if you are starting out or are in college and need a part time job. Their summer internship was honestly so much fun. After my internship they asked me to move up to a Community
cons: ultant. I worked part time at Avalon and went to school full time so it is manageable.

title: Great Company With Growth Opportunities!
pros: I've had the pleasure to work for AvalonBay Communities, Inc. for the past ten years and I'm proud to say I couldn't be happier with what I have been able to accomplish. AvalonBay definitely gives their employees the tools to seek promotional opportunities. People easily forget that it's up to the individual to continuously put themselves in positions to succeed and grow within any company. Like any career, nothing will be handed to you. You need to work hard to earn it. I've had the pleasure to personally promote many employees, which highlights AvalonBay's proven track record of promoting from within. If you're looking for a career in Sales, Customer Service, Maintenance, or Management, AvalonBay's Residential Services Department is definitely something to consider.
cons: I don't necessarily consider this a con because it's part of the industry, but dispositions are difficult.

title: Employees are taken care of
pros: The work life balance was really good. You get to have a set schedule (for the most part) and AvalonBay really does take great care of their employees. The training program is exceptionally good with many region wide classes set up for new employees. Quarterly events are very fun and a great way to recognize employees.
cons: I've never worked for a place that is perfect and I don't know that there is such a thing, Anything that may have ever come up was handled professionally and with care for the employees. Transferring was more difficult that I expected and ultimately is the reason I had to leave as I needed to relocate and there were not any open positions. However I am still waiting for something to pop up so that I can rejoin the AvalonBay Family!

title: Best Place I've Worked!
pros: Very collaborative environment. There is so much support for individuals and teams. I am given the opportunity to get involved in other aspects of the business outside of my standard daily responsibilities. I also genuinely believe the company cares about it's employees and it's customers. Leadership seeks feedback from all associates on a regular basis in hopes of making improvements. It's rewarding to feel like your opinion matters.
cons: No place is perfect! Technology is outdated however the company is making great strides in this area. There is also, at times, a lack of communication which causes challenges that could probably be avoided with better communication. Workload at times is overwhelming but I like being busy! With all of this said, this really is the best place I have ever worked. Again, no place is perfect!

title: THIS is where you want to work!
pros: I've worked for AvalonBay Communities for almost 8+ years. In that time, I have been continuously challenged to grow, not only professionally, but personally as well. I can give you a long list of reasons why this is where you want to work, but here is a short list. *Growth opportunities *Work/Life balance *Phenomenal training department *Amazing leadership, both on-site and in corporate offices *Connection to top leaders w/in the company (i.e. CEO, COO, etc.) *Co-workers that are more than associates, but a great support team *Brand recognition throughout the industry
cons: There isn't anything bad I can say about the company, other than I wish I had started my career here.

title: Best company to work for!
pros: I have been working for AvalonBay for 10 years now. You will notice that there are a lot of long term associates and this is due, in part, to the appreciation they show their employees. I have never worked for a company that has been more devoted to their associates. They offer great benefits, great compensation, opportunities for advancement, excellent support and training, and a level of motivation that keeps you WANTING to come to work, rather than HAVING to come to work!!! I know this sounds silly but I tell everyone "I have the best job in the world" and I genuinely mean it!
cons: Honestly, the fact that they are so associate oriented prohibits me from considering other opportunities, even if it means a better financial opportunity.

title: Great local team, people with their hearts in their work!
pros: I just completed my first year with the company, my second job in this industry. Avalon Bay is a company with a LOT of spirit and camaraderie among the employees ("Teamwork makes the dream work!"). I would highly recommend considering opportunities at AvalonBay! High standards for property operation - its a pleasure every day to show off our community to prospective residents Great onboarding process, lots of helpful sales training, regular company gatherings to recognize and reward achievement Management is supportive, reasonable, and very approachable Great benefit package
cons: Pay is on par with the industry, I wish it was closer to the higher end of the pay scale.

title: Stressful job, great commission
pros: -Meeting or overachieving monthly lease goals made for a really nice bonus check -Great coworkers -Great benefits of vision, dental, 401k, and medical with a HSA option -Housing discount for associates -Associate appreciation days once a quarter -Some vacation and PTO
cons: -Very, very stressful job between balancing paperwork, tours, move-ins, move-outs, and addressing resident concerns as they arise (and then creating a paper trail for said concern). -base pay is not very good, the months you don’t meet your sales goal are a struggle -Very minimal upper management support -Made to feel guilty for taking time off or calling in sick because other people have to pick up your “slack” when you’re gone

title: Maintenance Manager
pros: Corporate truly does have a focus on customer service and full understands the needs of maintenance. Additional costs were met with little more than a need for explanation before approval, they understand that maintenance issues come up and need to be addressed. The frowned on the typical management company's method of putting a bandaid on things...Avalon wanted it fixed and fixed right the first time.
cons: Too many of the "senior" team members were promoted based on years of service instead of looking to their more qualified. I don't want to say it was a good ol boys club but many of the Senior Maintenance managers lacked the skills needed for the new age of computers.

title: Great company to work for
pros: This company is great! The manager are the best I have ever worked with. They really promote from within. Training was awesome I felt ready and confident to start leasing. The management turn over rate is low. The managers are very knowledgeable and very open to positive training moments. I'm very proud to work for this company they are always doing things for the employees. i can not say enough great things about Avalon bay. I have worked at two communities in my almost year and a half and both my managers and team were awesome!
cons: Hourly rate and housing discount. I have worked for other properties that paid more and a larger housing discount, but was treated like another number. Avalon is worth looking past the cons.

title: Great People, Great Culture, Great Place to work
pros: Job Growth/enrichment opportunities, great benefits, time off, tuition reimbursement, excellent work-life balance, and a corporate culture that revolves around a core of values that drive the business at all levels. That last one might sound corny (I thought so) but its truly a game changer and really contributes to loving where I work vs just showing up for a check.
cons: Personally, I have none that are any more forthcoming than any other company. Of course, you can never make too much money. I have heard of people complain about amounts of work but to that I say, slackers need not apply, you wont make it long.

title: A Company that understands you
pros: Avalon ensures that you are not just an employee but a team member. They ensure that we are heard and understood. I have had multiple training classes, but not just from a trainer who has not idea what leasing is like, it has always been from someone who has (or is currently) doing the exact job that I am doing. I love that we can all get together and exchange ideas, concerns and experiences. What is better is that Avalon encourages and sponsors these unions. I feel like I am part of family!
cons: Seems as though some decisions that could easily be made onsite (lower management) are not allowed and take a little longer to get an answer. I have not been here long enough to see the advantage of this.

title: Great company.
pros: I work out of the South Orange County region. I have been with the company for a little over 3 years and I am proud to say that Avalon Bay is a great company to work for. Based on experience: -Staff: AvalonBay is staffed with some of the most dedicated, driven, hardworking associates I have ever had the pleasure of working with and/or meeting. Company Events: AvalonBay hosts quarterly events to show their appreciation towards their associates. The corporate team puts a lot of time and effort in planning these events to ensure they are not only a great success, but fun & unforgettable as well. Growth: AvalonBay is perpetually looking to expand and has done so in recent months which means, the opportunity for growth is always there.
cons: No cons at this time.

title: Great Program with Excellent Training
pros: -Great sense of community, people practice what they preach -Software and daily activities are easy to pick up and accomplish with the tools provided to you -No day is ever the same as others
cons: -Policies sometimes tended to be more strict than need be -As an intern, there can be situations were you are not going to receive compensation such as commission for the leases you work to sign -Residents can be aggressive, angry, or uneasy to please and this can be challenging if you have not handled these situations before on your own.

title: A Spirit of Caring & Continuous Improvement
pros: AvalonBay's culture is a huge pro! One of AvalonBay's core values is "a spirit of caring". This is seen day in and day out. They care about their employees and the residents living in each apartment community. Each year the company designates a month to volunteering and helping it's communities. The organization encourages it's employees to take some time from their day to day jobs and give back where they can. The company also strives for continuous improvement. Associates at different communities and other corporate departments collaborate and continuously try to improve how they can provide the best experience for all of AvalonBay's residents.
cons: Some of the company's databases and systems are very old, but they are slowly transitioning to newer technology. This will greatly improve how individuals do their daily jobs across the company.

title: Great teamwork
pros: Amazing coworkers that are always willing to stay late and help each other. Great training from online modules and surrounding co workers. Good benefits for dental and medical. You get the regular sick and vacation time off. Learn a lot of skills that help in the customer service and sales field.
cons: High goals that affect your commission if you don't meet them. Difficult resident issues with noise complaints from the building being wood frame. Also very hard conversations when the rent increases too high during renewals. High turnover with staff.

title: Maintenance Manager
pros: Great company to work for! Green and sustainability focused, diverse workforce with ample opportunities for advancement and favorable compensation and benefits. After almost 2 decades as a contractor, AvalonBay was really the only property management company or REIT that I considered a career change for.
cons: I really have not encountered many cons at this point. Like any corporation, especially a publicly traded REIT, it can sometimes seems like changes or approvals can take some time. That said, there has been a push, since the start of my employment several years ago, towards recognizing the need to analyze every aspect of the operation, diagnose issues and make changes - especially in the areas of associate engagement and satisfaction as well as public reputation.

title: Zero Regard For Operations Employees
pros: There isn't much here to brag about. They do have a lot of technology and reporting that makes your life easy, but they also plan to just do away with all on-site employees, so even that is a double-edged sword
cons: Constantly dividing people into groups based on immutable characteristics. This person should be in this group because of something he/she/they have no control over and this person over here should be in this group. Then they will go on to seemingly fill quotas based on needing more from group x, y, or z with little to no regard for performance whatsoever.

title: Great Place to Work!
pros: I have worked for Avalon for 10 years now. One of the largest reasons that I choose to stay are the opportunities for advancement that are available to those that seek them out. Additionally I feel that the company seeks to act morally in many aspects, such as equitable wages between male and female employees, and implementing a "living wage" vs a minimum wage across all positions. Another aspect is the people! Leaders are encouraged to mentor associates and share knowledge, and this just trickles down to everyone!
cons: The tuition reimbursement could be more robust. There is a focus on continually seeking improvement, which is great; but can create some stress as this means that things are generally changing pretty regularly.

title: Absolutely the best!!!
pros: Excellent training program and learning and development team, growth opportunity based on how hard you work and frequent performance discussions, one of the most associate focused cultures I have ever experienced, tools to be successful, great people all around, no title snobs. Frequent associate surveys and they actually make changes based on the results! Very driven to support you to provide excellent customer service..and you are empowered to make decisions! Great health benefits and a good bonus structure.
cons: Technology..with a company this large, it has been a struggle, but AVB is well aware and actively working to make it better. Salaries are a little on the low side, but the culture and loving where you work, and the bonus program make up for it.

title: Pretty Good
pros: Advancement with in the company. Nice co workers. Nice properties to maintain. Fair market properties are a maintenance tech dream. Low income it gets not so nice.
cons: On call is tough with a young family, vague Oncall hour hourly rates. They let you monitor everything but you have to go out of your way to check. HR in general are non existent. And for a company that made over a billion in profits they are constantly under staffing, and under budgeting all their communities.

title: Mostly Positive
pros: Cares very deeply for their employees' wellbeing; very giving; ethical/generous/professional
cons: The pay hurts sometimes, I wish the CSS/SSS positions made a little more; the new pay-structure for leasing agents needs to be adjusted so it's less severe (too crippling is not meeting the goal, far too rewarding on exceeding... needs to be tightened up a bit). The new Lead Pilot is very irritating & I'd much prefer it be in the hands of the SM/SSS to divvy out leads & monitor their lead mgmt. Too many initiatives are promoting cutthroat competition in leasing & it's very divisive/hurtful to the team dynamics/morale as a whole. Company needs to modernize some things too... solar energies, app's, etc.

title: Maintenance Supervisor
pros: People are great, Company not afraid to promote employees to management level positions!!! Company is very customer driven and is willing to go the extra mile for them.
cons: Not speaking in regards to my pay but I am speaking in behalf of my employees...Pay is'nt all that great. our competitors pay $3-$5 more for the similar positions. We ask so much out of them on a daily basis but the pay definitely does not reflect that at all!

title: Sr. Community Manager
pros: The benefits are great, and the culture of the company is a perfect fit for me. The working hours allow for a healthy work/life balance, and the company offers many resources for running a successful site. The company promotes from within on a regular basis, and takes associate feedback very seriously. The company is continuously improving and innovating. I love being part of a company that rewards driven associates, and views employees as valuable team members.
cons: The pay scale is slightly lower than other property management companies. This can be challenging when hiring an associate. However, while it may take longer to find the right person to join our team, we typically find team members who appreciate the environment, and vast opportunities provided by Avalonbay.

title: Good benefits but terrible pay
pros: Good stock plan and benefits once you reach your 90 day period
cons: Pay is really low compared to other companies in the industry and the bonus structure is the worst. Can get leases and renewals for 40k in a month and you make $900 in commission seem like the % is off. Over worked and under paid since they like to keep the amount of employees at a minimum to run these properties. Someone get sick or take vacation good luck your running everything by yourself.

title: Good place to work
pros: They let good employees go for few $$. My supervisor was awesome. Pmd was not really bad not either good. So so. It’s always who you work with , I was running two properties which is more than 800 unites. They never recognized my talent. And let me go when I asked for few more $$ . I would like thank you WILL. He was always there when we needed him. But not the upper management. I am giving them 5 star because of my property manger and my maintenance supervisor.
cons: Need to see people talent. Not the money .

title: This is a great company to work for.
pros: A company with real culture that values its associates. This company is continuously improving and looking at innovative ways to not only conduct business but also treat employees well.
cons: Nothing is perfect, but when compared to other companies (bigger and smaller) Avalon combines the best of the best. This is a solid REIT to work for with smart associates.

title: Great place to build your career!
pros: Why roll the dice, hoping you are working for a good organization? Avalon Bay provides the stability and growth potential that stands alone. With excellent training, talented colleagues, great benefits and growth potential that is second to none, with Avalon Bay you don't have to take chance! Strengthen your existing skills or build a new career. Avalon Bay is the right choice!
cons: There can be reservations in working for a large company. I worried that I would get lost and would just be a number, waiting years to advance. Avalon Bay provides the camaraderie and growth potential that is not typical in a large organization. However, Avalon Bay is not your typical organization it is exceptional.

title: Great place to work, but understaffed
pros: Pay is decent, benefits are really good. Staff and atmosphere are amazing. Hands down the nicest and most welcoming place I've ever worked. Training is long and extensive, but they totally set you up for success! Managers are very communicative and give good, constructive feedback (they regularly ask for feedback on themselves as well).
cons: Pay could be a bit more (other places starting wage is a little higher). Most communities are very understaffed right now so all employees are trying to pick up the slack. No option to work remote or do hybrid schedule for community consultant (leasing agent).

title: A Great Work Family Coast to Coast!
pros: I have worked for Avalon for several years in 3 states. Avalon is a national company with many amazing opportunities. The company believes in promotion from within and first consideration is truly given to associates who have worked hard and demonstrated their abilities. Avalon is always willing to try new things, mess up, and try again. It's the reason it's always on the forefront of the Property Management industry. Upper Level Management knows what they are doing and do a good job at communicating what is going on.
cons: It's not the company that will pay you the most but the happiness outweighs the income.

title: Great people, poor advancement opportunities.
pros: Good benefits, great holiday schedule, opportunity for great compensation at the right property. Do not have to work Sundays. The staff on-site is very friendly and helpful. Company does events 2-3 times a year.
cons: This company does not have the best hours including Saturdays unless in upper management. The training is not the best medium (a lot of online based solo training). The company will sometimes overlook an internal promotion and hire an outside canidate and rely on current employees to provide training which is very discouraging when attempting to move forward in career. It is hard to advance unless you work for the right manager that can get you noticed for the hard work you do.

title: Great Company
pros: One of the best companies to work for in the industry. Pay is Average, benefits are good, but company culture is what makes it worth it. Having managers that support you even when your needing to grow in areas is priceless.
cons: The industry itself is paying to much attention to Google and Yelp reviews. It is not really considering the unique attributes of individual locations and communities that make them great or not so great. Being bonused on service related scores when price is the number one cause of low service scores is not really fair.

title: My Best Career Path
pros: The employers are always willing to invest their time and resources to ensure you are able to do your best! The pay is competitive in this current market. There are also periodic reviews that evaluate your work performance, making sure your goals are staying in line with your career path. Overall, ever since joining the team at AvalonBay, I have always felt supported by not only my immediate colleagues, but from other colleagues in the surrounding area! If you want to be successful, you definitely have the tools to do so!
cons: Depending on your property, you do have to work weekends, which isn't all bad!

title: Excellent place to work
pros: -Excellent work life balance -They really promote from within, it's not just a sales pitch -Basically unlimited growth potential -They invest in the community and promote volunteering (and you get paid for it if it's during your work hours!) -All of the senior management are approachable. You never feel like you are "below" anyone else. -Amazing training program -The benefits beat out anything I have ever had before (affordable insurance, 401k, stock purchase, they even offer transportation benefits and pet insurance now!)
cons: I can't think of any, I'm genuinely happy with my career. The only issue might be slow computer systems but they are working on that and I feel as though that's an issue at most places!

title: Sleepy place to work
pros: Workday is 9-6. Not expected to work long hours. Time well spent is their motto. You don't have to do overtime. A good place for working mothers who don't mind a sleepy company without much potential for career development. If you like to show up 9 to 6 to get a steady paycheck without having to put in a whole lot of effort, this is the place for you. It's a very feminine and motherly type of job.
cons: ultant

title: Great people and excellent culture
pros: on the whole, people genuinely seem to care about the work they do and the people that they work with. The idea of work hard/ play hard is definitely in effect. there is a lot to do and the company is constantly looking for ways to improve itself which is great. Lots of collaboration but haven't encountered any micromanagement. I am capable of doing my work and reaching out if need be.
cons: still using some older systems. There are so many systems and places to find information its difficult to get some things done just due to all the information being in different places.

title: Good people, bad management
pros: The people you work with (both associates and residents) are great. There are a lot of tools to make the job easier, although they sometimes miss the mark. The hours are predictable office hours (M-F or T-Sa) and you get bonuses and paid time off, including holidays. There is room to move laterally within the company.
cons: - Upper management does not understand the onsite experience and cannot offer useful guidance or set realistic expectations. We were expected to request reviews and to get positive NPS results, but most residents would not recommend a community where grounds are not being kept up and the rent increases significantly every year even if their service requests are done in 3 hours. - There is often a breakdown of communication between parties (management, associates, office, maintenance, residents, vendors, etc.) which makes the job harder than it needs to be. - AvalonBay is publicly traded and has a responsibility to its shareholders, but has lost sight of the human side of this people-centered business. Upper management is more concerned with profits than its own people. The worst part was getting to know a family after leasing them an apartment for 12 months and then increasing their rent 25% if they wished to renew. - General lack of loyalty and minimal career advancement opportunities. It was more common for an associate to leave AVB for another property management company and then be rehired in a higher position with a raise than for someone to actually be promoted from within. They typically hired supervisors from outside of the company and often ended up hiring incompetent or unprofessional associates.

title: Best job I've ever had!
pros: The people are amazing! It feels like we are all equal because even when an SVP talks to you, you get the sensation that they are just as normal as you. They don't think of themselves as better than others because of their position and they encourage you to do your best! The benefits are amazing (although dental could be a bit better) but they have amazing benefits!
cons: The rents are way to high to afford living at one of the locations. I understand that it is what makes AvalonBay's money but it would be nice if we as associates could afford it a bit more.

title: Values are changing
pros: It's a strong company. It's well structured with the clear directions on company policies.
cons: Unfortunately company started to become more and more are a number driven company. Arch stone had 40% employee discount, AVB has only 20 %. On top of that they reduced the available free housing to 1 per property. No employees can afford to live in the communities, and when there is a snow storm they struggle running the business because no one can make it to work. That's why there was a housing available per 100 apartments. Whomever lived on the community would report to work at where they lived.

title: I love it here!
pros: Great company that treats their employees well and makes you feel valued. They have a lot of events for employees and training's that elevate your value. They understand that they need to provide you with the support and tools in order to excel in your job. You also have a seat at the table - They truly believe in collaboration and that means that they actually listen to employee thoughts, comments, ideas and they make changes and adjustments accordingly.
cons: Two words - Lotus Notes is the emailing system. Its hard to regress back to an old form of technology BUT they heard the employees and are changing out the system at the end of 2015.

title: Fantastic Company With Top Notch Training
pros: AvalonBay is a fantastic company that truly cares about its employees. From my first day up until my 90th day, my team has been overly supportive with my training process and are always following up to ensure I am striving to be my best self. The companies goals and vision are clear and you really feel that you are contributing to the success of the company everyday. Coming from retail management, it is refreshing to be able to able to spend the time with your residents and really provide top-notch customer service to them and AvalonBay will provide you with the proper tools and resources all along the way!
cons: Can't think of any at the moment!

title: Great company that cares deeply about their customers and values their associates.
pros: We have bright, highly engaged associates who care deeply about what we are doing everywhere here. This makes for an amazing work environment. Associates are encouraged to go out of our way to help customers. AvalonBay selects people who are service oriented. We have deep rooted core values that shine through how we work. We are very stable and financially sound. We have been growing through acquisitions and have a strong development pipeline. I have attended three apartment community grand openings in the last month in Southern California. This brings many growth opportunities.
cons: If you're not a service orineted person, don't apply.

title: Great People, Great Company, Great Work!!
pros: AvalonBay Communities is an excellent company that has a true focus on delivering excellent products and a commitment to its associates. There is a true commitment to integrity throughout the company. The organization always looks to grow and promote and is continuously improving all aspects of the business. I am continually amazed at the tenure of people at the company, which in my mind is a true indicator of how great a place is to work. Everyone is passionate about the work and helping out each other.
cons: There are very limited Cons, but work flows can sometimes take longer than expected. This is can be fairly typical with large organizations compared with smaller ones.

title: Great Company!
pros: I have only worked for AvalonBay for a short period but it was immediately obvious that they truly care about their employees well being. They have taken many steps to limit employee exposure during the pandemic by implementing paid time off and staggering shifts. Their policies and procedures are well thought out and documented to give clear and precise direction for most situations. The systems in place for conducting work duties are easy to use, typically work well and provide solid feedback to to make improvements to productivity and quality of work.
cons: As with any business profitability is important but it can be a fine line between profits and proper operating budgets.

title: Outstanding personnel, benefits and oppportunities for growth
pros: AvalonBay has one of the beat "team" mentalities of any company I have worked for. Everyone truly works for the benefit of our customers, company, and co-workers. With the amount of company growth and expansion, there are always avenues and opportunities for advancement and exploring new positions if so desired. My co-workers are some of the most knowledgable minds and fun people to work with. The work load, challenges and demands on your skills are high, which keeps things exciting and interesting.
cons: Pay rates are lower than comparitive jobs in other companies. Communication between different facets of the company could be improved.

title: Love AVB
pros: AVB is an awesome company that really cares about their employees and communities. I feel they pay fairly and benefits are good. I am so happy to have made my career at AVB.
cons: The only "con" is that because we have properties all over the country, we rarely get to meet many of the folks we deal with over email on a daily basis. I wish we could have some type of event where we could all meet at some point (logistically impossible, most likely, but a nice thought).

title: Love the Culture!
pros: Before I started working at AvalonBay, I was with another company for 10 years. An opportunity presented itself that I could not pass up and decided to pursue a career with AvalonBay. I was very nervous initially but after 6 months I am very confident that I made me the best decision in my career. AvalonBay truly lives by their mission statement and values. They care about their associates, community, and environment. I see that on display everyday!
cons: None at this point.

title: AvalonBay Makes A Difference!
pros: Work/Life Balance is amazing in my dept; Very flexible; Open door policy; Fun & Friendly environment; Offer a good variety of benefits; Genuinely cares about their employees and residents.
cons: Not a lot of cons - but one big one and is a game changer for some: Bonuses are only offered to Managers and up. Administrative Assistants and Coordinators are not offered any type of bonus, but do endless amounts of work to get their departments to hit their bonuses. It has never made sense, but hopefully one day they will offer bonuses across the board. This will, in turn, boost moral and benefit the company in so many ways.

title: Varies from Region to Region
pros: Love the company culture and how supportive most of my peers were.
cons: I was unable to afford to continue working for Avalon because they pay less than the cost of living in each region and do not offer a great discount.

title: Sales and Service Supervisor
pros: -great environment with great coworkers. -new pay structure is competitive however it's very driven. -opportunities come up with the company growing so rapidly. -love what I do
cons: No direct cons. Love the company and people I currently work with. However I would say that some managers are a-holes!

title: Not bad but could have been better.
pros: Plenty of opportunities to transfer to different locations; plenty of opportunities to network with other co-workers; very structured once you start doing the job; they give back to the community through volunteering. It's a good place to get your feet wet in this industry.
cons: Promotions based on who you know not what you know or how hard you work. Not enough training or guidance in the beginning.

title: Community is key.
pros: I don't have a typical day - when I get to work every day is a growth opportunity and I'm constantly supported in my development by management. Work-Life balance is something you'll hear from a lot of other companies but AVB lives it.
cons: AVB's benefits package is somewhat outdated (you have to have been here for >10 years (or something around there) to earn more than 10 days of vacation per year if you're not a manager.) But it has been changing a good amount recently, so hopefully this concern won't last much longer.

title: Stable employer but far too bureaucratic.
pros: Mostly friendly on-site workers Good pay for the workload. Decent benefits. Some very good, and supportive managers
cons: The Customer Care Center at HQ is pretty awful. Although there are a few good people there, most are incompetent and unfriendly. Regional managers frequently spoke of advancements, but promotions were very rare and highly political. I knew some very qualified people at my level who should have been promoted but were overlooked several times. Very hard to get weekends off unless you were a regional manager. Spent money on things that made no sense, but then wouldn't spend money on other things that seemed pretty important.

title: Great culture! Great growth opportunities!
pros: AvalonBay has numerous growth opportunities and a positive support system. Coming from a company where my growth opportunities were very limited, I was thrilled to be a part of a company that has given me numerous opportunities to be promoted, learn new skills, and become a leader. Great team environment. This is a company that I would like to retire from. Not having to work on Sundays is a plus in this industry, not to mention having numerous paid holidays, and generous amount of vacation time and sick time.
cons: Medical and dental benefits are a little more expensive than my last company for the actual employee, but family costs are lower.

title: Clique-ish Culture, Promotes Corporate Brown-nosers
pros: Great benefits, matching 401k program, and chances for promotion. Base pay was average, starting at $15/hour for Leasing in the Bay Area. Lots of structure, lots of organization. Clear channels of communication between the corporate office, Customer Care Center, and other offices. Great software, Salesforce and MRI are great platforms in order to keep communication open and clear.
cons: They expect A LOT out of an employee, which can be a good thing. Depending on the portfolio director, these expectations can be scrupulous and unrealistic. The way they treat residents is uncanny: $300 - $400 rent increases for renewals, even above going market rate is outrageous. Some community managers were horrible. They would sit in the back office and talk on the phone ALL DAY, refusing to help residents even when residents were requesting to speak to a manager. One manager in particular used to swear and speak loudly about residents in a derogatory way even when there were other people (non-staff) in the office. So horrible. Want to get promoted? Make sure to brown nose your way to the top and hang out with upper management. It's a very clique-ish culture.They say merit gets your way up towards a promotion... only if you have a manager that supports and shows an employee the tools to succeed. But mostly, it's who you turn your brown nose towards and how well you can show off. Hard work really only keeps you employed, but not necessarily promoted. In the end, the bottom line is what it comes down to: profit for stockholders.

title: Exemplary Response to COVID-19
pros: AvalonBay has proven its core value of "Spirit of Caring" throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. These are just a few of the changes the company made to make this time a little easier for employees: - 6 weeks of emergency paid leave to employees affected by COVID-19 - flexible scheduling for associates who need to take care of their families - 100% paid medical care for anything related to COVID-19 - and a number of other benefits to help us during this time
cons: No cons at this time. I am so proud to work for AvalonBay.

title: Poor training for first time leasing consultants, and cut throat management.
pros: pay was avarage at $15 plus 75 per lease and renewal many good ideas for a company the people they got from Archstone were actually very nice and cool
cons: They expected people to make sweet lemonade out of rotten lemons Absolutely poor training for first time leasing consultants. All about the numbers Unprofessional managers Arrogant associates Many good ideas yet poor execution of those ideas Did not like to pay for overtime and were cheap on materials

title: Not too shabby
pros: Management is very consistent across the boards in terms of rolling out new plans or campaigns to improve the company. There are many opportunities to move around due to the large volume of properties across the country. Employee engagement has improved in just the time that I have worked for the company. I feel like Management legitimately cares about their associates and trying to keep them happy.
cons: Pay/bonus system seems relatively low in comparison to other property management companies. Associate discount is pretty low as well.

title: A great company to work for
pros: From the top down, employee satisfaction is event in every area. Avalon is constantly looking at ways to improve performance through it's people and procedures in place. Employees are empowered to "do the right thing" when it comes to our customers, which makes for a great work environment. Training is one of the best for any company I've worked with, as well as on the job training. Love working for this company!
cons: The only down side is that there isn't much turnover from the manager positions, but that goes to show that employees are staying with Avalon for long periods of time.

title: Great people and good company overall
pros: I work at the Corporate Office and we have about 270 Associates. Everyone is friendly and there is such a wide variety of people with different backgrounds, which always makes for interesting lunchroom conversations! Associates from different departments are willing to help out, even if you are asking form something outside of their normal scope.
cons: Upward growth for women is somewhat lacking and even sometimes discouraged and not supported, especially for working mothers. Although we are constantly told we are paid above industry standard, it is not the case for all positions. We generally have good time off policies, although there is no materniry leave available.

title: Maintenance Supervisor
pros: Opens doors for promotions and growth. Good compensation. Good benefits. Customer service focused.
cons: Depending on the higher ups, not much help if you are low staffed such as your team being fired or on vacation, there isn’t much back up. No floating team. Very low annual raises.

title: Unprofessional
pros: There is nothing positive to say about this company.
cons: Not only is this company disorganized, unprofessional and dysfunctional but they don't enforce their own policies. All they care about is ripping of the consumers not by increasing their renewals over 10% the following year using scare tactics. This is the most disgusting organization and a lot of unethical practices they preach. If you are young and looking to get taking advantage of apply at AvalonBay Communities where you learn bad customer service practices. This might go under the radar but let it be known they don't care about you as a person and will intimate you at all costs if you don't learn how to play their game. I would advise that their cult sales tools is worse than a used car dealership. Enjoying lying through your teeth to potential clients.

title: Great Company to Work For
pros: I have been working part time for AVB for 7 years. I have nothing but great things to say about them. From the CEO on down to the managers on site. Whenever I had a problem, they jumped on it and corrected it right away. They treat you fairly. Be a good employee and they will be good to you.
cons: The only thing I can think of is that they do not have properties in the South or Midwest. They tend to be in very high COL states but that's okay. That is their business model.

title: Former Multifamily Development Director for Southern California
pros: Great culture, strong senior management that is friendly and approachable, great internal resources to provide support to developers. Great reputation with with strong balance sheet and well-established platform and procedures.
cons: The consummate 800-pound gorilla, they are not nimble. New ideas require extensive study, and the analytic discipline can border at times on paralysis by analysis. National contracts/standards with individual providers for items like signage, naming, and creative design can be very limiting to flexibility. Somewhat of an east-coast bias with over-emphasis on pedigree.

title: Great Company
pros: Benefits are competitive Great social interaction with employees Residents are nice Training is beneficial Amenities to offer residents are limitless Great employees that care about their job.
cons: Compared to other companies, compensation is pretty low. I got started at $14.50 last year and got an increase of only 43 cents. I hope at some point that Avalonbay realizes that people cannot simply live off of bonuses alone. There are really slow seasons and we shouldn't have to wait 9 months just to see a decent paycheck. I also wish the associate housing discount increased at least by 10%. I just wish hard working employees were rewarded and compensated for what they're worth.

pros: At first I loved my job!! Easy going, good pay, great hours, holiday time and vacation is great. Love my benefits, (I'm sure there is better but this is manageable.) Good work life balance. Company events are fun and MOST people are great to work with. Regular evaluations with pay increases (although they are rigged to cap you at a certain level of excellence for financial reasons. This is not a joke, it's been happening my entire career and when I first started I was in denial of it but now it's just getting old)
cons: As time goes on you do more and more work outside of your "job description" or "title". This is great for development but eventually enough is enough. It makes employees feel like they are doing the job of a Community Manager (which they LITERALLY are) but just don't get paid the same or get the same benefits. The same is true for Community Consultants, several CC's take on a lot more responsibility yet can't seem to be promoted. Maintenance Supervisor's are in the same boat, usually running a property with no direction from maintenance manager or senior. Even maintenance tech positions find themselves in the same boat. Avalon keeps staffing small to keep costs down. Most of this stems specifically from "podded" communities. Company favors certain employees which include offering better housing discounts to one person over another. The stress of doing more than one persons job with NO thanks or recognition is becoming extremely draining.

title: A company that cares about its people
pros: I have worked for AvalonBay for a number of years and continue to be impressed with the company's commitment to its employees. Management asks for feedback on a regular basis and takes action on it. Employees are given opportunities to grow, are recognized for their efforts and are proud to work for the company.
cons: Something is always changing (for the better) at AvalonBay, so don't apply to this company if you don't like variety and change in your work. There is also more work to get done than time in the day, so prioritization is also a key to success here.

title: Good for now.....
pros: Avalon is decent company. They are always working on improving processes and rolling out new customer service programs, etc.There is room for growth and transfer opportunities as the company is large and has properties in markets. Most paid holidays of any company I've worked for. Quarterly meetings and summer picnics with the rest of the day off are also a nice incentive.
cons: Pay is low. If you're offered a job, negotiate your salary because it's not going up much from there once employed. I have also seen great employees be pushed out of the company by upper management. Which makes me wonder if I'm actually valued.

title: I love my job, but the pay makes me question if it's worth it.
pros: I have been an associate at AvalonBay for quite some time and I have to say that I do love my job. There are multiple opportunities for growth, and the company and management teams want their associates to be successful. They've handled COVID-19 incredibly well from a safety standpoint and I'm grateful for that.
