We receive good benefits (health insurance, 401k, 20% off of rent if you live in an AvalonBay Community, etc.), and they have standard, but still good, time off policies. My teammates and almost every single associate I've met so far are incredible people, and they make this job better and I am happy to come to work because of them. I have the opportunity to make a difference in my residents' lives, which I love, and I have a lot of power to make my own decisions in how I work with my residents from a customer service standpoint. Finally, there is definitely flexibility in my position to take on projects and make them my own, from planning resident events to coordinating new programming and more.
cons: Simply put, no matter how much I do love my job and where I work, I don't make nearly enough to live at any of our Communities, even with a 20% discount, and still have enough money in my budget for expenses for food, utilities, transportation, and to put enough money in my savings account every month (this doesn't even take my student debt into consideration, let alone other expenses). Unfortunately, this describes not only living on my own at one of our communities, but also living with a roommate or possibly even two. My hourly rate is extremely low compared to our competitors (~$18/hour), and while our previous bonus plan provided the opportunity to make at least an additional $2,000 or more per month on average (and that is definitely the lower end of what I've seen for my bonuses), my new "bonus" is likely only going to be $1,000 per month - enough to cover my hourly rate's taxes. Because we are understaffed (no matter how much my manager lets higher-ups know we need another associate at my location), and even if we weren't, for the amount of work I do and the amount of energy I put into my job, as well as the amount of customers that I work with daily (including those that are immeasurably difficult to please), I question almost every day how much longer this path will be feasible for me. Aside from that, we are constantly measured by net promoter scores that are not applicable to the management staff (i.e., "the building could use some work", "the rent is too high", etc.), and when I asked who to provide feedback to about this, I was shot down because "this has been in place for years". Finally, on the days where I work by myself, I find that I work far more than eight hours in a day, to the point of where, for a long time, I consecutively wasn't getting back home while it was still light out. Ultimately, I feel as though I am doing the work of what a supervisor would be doing in another property management company, but in no way am I being paid a comparable amount of money to make the job and the hard work worth it. I don't want to leave AvalonBay at all, but I still often find myself checking for new job postings at other companies that may offer better pay and a better work/life balance and I plan to apply for new positions elsewhere when they open if things do not change soon.

title: Strong culture of team first attitude
pros: Having worked for this company for 4 years now, transferred couple times but the culture stays the same amongst different teams/properties. Very positive experience with whomever I get to work with.
cons: tant focus from upper management on associate development with plenty of room for growth. Some of the best life lessons on work ethic, teamwork and learning to expand myself personally, came from managers I've been blessed to assist.

title: Community consultant
pros: AvalonBay is a great company with genuine people. I love working for this company because the management is very hands on and encouraging. The team i work with is the best. There’s so much teamwork to help each other succeed. Management is very understanding when life just happens to throw something inconvenient your way. AvalonBay has a great training course and also has meaningful core values. I gave never been happier at any job! Excited to see what my career with AvalonBay will consist of!
cons: The only con i can think of is, having to work Saturday’s. My community makes it worth it though!

title: I'm so fortunate to work here.
pros: AvalonBay is an organization that is focused on continual improvement and being a great place to work. The company attracts top talent and people that care. This combination creates a great work environment that becomes more like family than co-workers. Associates have the opportunity to grow their careers here within their field or across departments. It's really an honor to be in this environment.
cons: It's a big company that is focused on their fiscal responsibilities to their shareholders and their employees. This is a good thing but it can lean towards conservatism on certain decisions. It's the right thing to do but it can slow some ideas or opportunities.

title: Fantastic Company With Below Average Bonuses
pros: This Company is one of the best companies I have worked for on many fronts they emphasize or have... Employee Development A balanced approach to work and life Good Benefits Package including stock options They hire good people to work with and for. (Not a pro or con, pay is about average for the industry.)
cons: The only con I experienced would be the worst bonus structure of any company I have worked for in the industry.

title: Awesome Company!
pros: I was brought into the AvalonBay family when AvalonBay acquired Archstone Communities a few years ago. At first I was apprehensive, but quickly discovered that this company actually LISTENS to its associates and treats them like valuable assets. Avalon has truly grown to be a place that I enjoy working. Pay is good, work life balance is good, management treats you like family, easy to promote.
cons: I would like to see more properties in other parts of the LA county market. Would love the opportunity to be able to promote and be closer to home! (Long Beach)

title: Hard work is rewarded
pros: Mentoring and training available but you have to be the driver behind it. Work hard and be a leader and you will be promoted. Great company culture of caring not only for residents and staff but also the community. They may ask for your blood.... to donate. Company is still continuing to grow and is not too proud to change with the times and the cultures. Some companies become entrenched in the way things are done and cannot face realities but not AvalonBay. If it don't work, they try and fix it.
cons: Front line employees were market adjusted but hopefully more ranking employees are next.

title: Best in Class Company with Great Career Opportunities
pros: AvalonBay has been a leading the multifamily industry for over 25 years and continues to be an exciting, innovative, and rewarding place to work. Continued growth in the company means great long term career opportunities here. It has a great culture of hiring 'good people' and finding the best path for long-term success. Great leadership.
cons: Not much to say here. It is a "big" company so there is a bit of a corporate culture - AVB is always, however, looking for feedback from all associates on how to be a better company for everyone who works there.

title: Great Company
pros: I've been with AvalonBay, working in the leasing office, for 2.5 years now and I have no complaints. The company hires like-minded people and provides you with all the tools and training needed to succeed in your role. Salary is competitive with annual increases, and annual vacation time that increases with tenure. They offer a refreshing team dynamic and a strict work/home life balance where taking your vacation time is encouraged. I originally thought that AvalonBay would be my stepping stone, but I can't imagine a different job that could take me away.
cons: Regional Directors don't always know/remember what it's like day-to-day in the office and are a little out of touch.

title: Poor experience with a seemingly good company
pros: The day for volunteer work. The company values. Having appreciation days for maintenance. The ability to get stock and feeling like you are like an owner.
cons: Having long tenure managers with poor crew management skills. Not being trained for job title and being expected to perform task, with little to no help or guidance. Having little inventory on for work orders. Shops being unorganized and organizing them for the higher ups inspections. Crews keeping different storage rooms and communication areas like a dump. Maintenance didn’t work as a team, just sub groups.

title: Fantastic
pros: Your day is never the same. It is so fun and exciting working here. Pay is great! I love the people. I actually enjoy going to work every day. There are many challenges when it comes to customer service but that keeps the job fresh. Its not easy. There are many things that go into property management and so much to learn. This is a great experience and can potentially be a long term career.
cons: Working Saturdays. Managers will take saturdays off no problem so if you can get into the managment side after working your butt off you don't always have to work saturdays forever.

title: Great company to work for, but very corporate-oriented
pros: Fair pay, monthly bonuses, plenty of training. Tend to hire fun and interesting people, so the work environment could be much worse.
cons: Cutting positions and giving more responsibility to others, which decreases opportunity to move up. Corporate-oriented decision making that doesn't always have the employee or residents' best interests in mind.

title: Great Company Culture & Values
pros: AvalonBay is true to their three core values: a commitment to integrity, a spirit of caring, and a focus on continuous improvement. Because of these values, I am happy to wake up in the morning and come to work as I know I will be respected and appreciated, be in an environment that fosters success and allows one to not only strive to better themselves but their local community too.
cons: This place is not for you if you don't like to be recognized for your hard work, be around genuine people, be in an environment that fosters success, or like a work/life balance.

title: Great Company - Growing Pains
pros: Good communication from top down, core values are practiced every day from the CEO down through the ranks, solid L&D department, makes sound and sold business decisions, overall management appreciative of your contributions to the company and its success.
cons: Growing pains! Became very departmentalized. As always with quick growth, they lost that sense of "personal". Employees feel less a part of the Company - just their department. Pay is low end. They compare salaries to REIT industry rather than to your specific position marketability.

title: Great company for growth
pros: They set you up for success and there is always room to climb the corporate ladder! Everyone is really nice! Quarterly events, If you are a top seller you get to go to appreciation events! Sales rallies are a tun of fun and informative! Great benefits!
cons: Out of all of the other Real estate investment companies the pay is pretty low.

title: Thoughtful Company
pros: Professional , Love the AVA brand
cons: Distance to Trainings is a lot but could be a pro it is training.

title: Loss Mitigation Recovery Specialist
pros: Nice work environment due to resent renovations. Avalonbay offers their employees free soft drinks along with tea and coffee.
cons: A lot of the tenured associates walk around feeling a since of low morale due to not being able to have a voice when it comes to possible improvements that could make the work flow smoother. Also it can be very frustrating because you never get a job descriptions of your day to day job so what you do can change in an instant and they don’t compensate well.

title: AvalonBay - More Pro's than Con's if you're willing to work hard!
pros: All AvalonBay Leasing Offices provide very dynamic and social atmospheres. Unlike most corporate positions, you won't sit at a window-less cube all day waiting for 5:00PM to come. Talking with prospective residents on community tours helps the day fly by and is also a great way to network. If you are an extrovert, AvalonBay is the place for you. Although many people criticize the company for high-turnover, I believe it's what you make of it. Avalon is a leader in the real estate industry and can become a crucial stepping stone for anyone interested in a career in property management. Bonuses can greatly contribute to one's overall yearly earnings and also helps to motivate employees across the board. The company also does fun events and contests throughout the year which keeps employees engaged and invested. When you spend every day making a difference in resident's lives, you enjoy your job and take great satisfaction in your day to day operations. If you are willing to work hard, AvalonBay is a great place to work.
cons: The pay is fair (not great, but not awful) but it seems like you won't reach a higher salary too easily. Promotions are given to those who work extremely hard, but also must put in lots of overtime hours. Hours are a huge con, and most offices don't close until 6:30PM. Working Saturdays is annoying, and extremely difficult when the rest of the world is on a 9-5 Mon-Fri schedule. Dealing with disgruntled residents everyday can be taxing, but that is the nature of customer service. Vacation time could be more generous, with 2 weeks off per year and just a handful of sick days. All time off balances accrue over the year, so time off must be strategically planned. Housing discount is appreciated, but dropped to 50% for managerial level employees which is unfortunate.

title: Co-workers make or break an amazing job
pros: Too many to list all, but good benefits, tons of promotion opportunities, well paying, most communities are very personal and professional.
cons: Getting stuck with entry level co-workers who have no drive/desire to better themselves and do just enough not to get fired. Office team tend to hold themselves as superiors to the maintenance team instead of co-workers. Extremely hard to be at full manning. Lack of on-call compensation, don't even get time and a half at times.

title: You can make impact
pros: In my experience at AvalonBay you always have the opportunity to make impact. I've always found management willing to listen to ideas and try things out, no matter what your position is. The company is big enough to have ample resources and small enough where you don't get lost in the shuffle. Good work is rewarded and recognized. Innovative things are happening on the digital side of the business which is exciting and positioning the company well for the future.
cons: Technology historically has been an issue, but the company is making significant investments to make things better.

title: Personal & Professional Growth
pros: Extremely stable environment. The company actually cares for the employees. They promote a more unified work environment. Extremely Customer Service Oriented Provides training for all the different software's needed
cons: Needs to have more user friendly softwares or programs. You need to search in a billion databases to find what you need. Slow softwares, long wait times to process things. Maintenance department is managed separately, Community Manager doesn't control or manage any of it.

title: Admirable Corporate Culture!
pros: I have worked for AvalonBay for 4 years (this month) and I have seen the best and worst aspects of the company and I am still very happy to come to work every day. The company is full of friendly, ambitious and generally happy employees and I feel this can be attributed to the culture. As a company, we focus on three core values; encouraging each other to do the right thing (commitment to integrity), individual growth (continuous improvement) and helping those in need (spirit of caring). These core values are also my own personal values and I take them very seriously in my life. I have also been able to travel with AvalonBay, moving from Northern Virginia to Orange County, CA then Los Angeles, back to OC and eventually back to Washington, DC. With each move I learned more about the company and was able to grow myself, being promoted twice in the last two years. I have also utilized the 20% housing discount living in an Avalon Community ever since I started working for the company. This was not only convenient, but also helped me to better understand our customers. I have been lucky enough to work with many different co-workers and managers and have had a generally positive experience everywhere I went. I am definitely happy with my experiences at AvalonBay!
cons: 1.) Frequent and/or sudden changes in policies, procedures and compensation. 2.) The housing discount could be better 3.) Disparity between the Corporate Office and On-Site Associates 4.) Navigating how to share ideas can be unnecessarily difficult 5.) Training is done mostly through online videos and is not my preferred method of learning.

title: Honestly A Wonderful Company to Work For
pros: There is ongoing training and plenty of opportunities to take on additional duties once you get the hang of your job. The company has a lot of different properties and openings so that you can transfer to a different site or even to the corporate office. People here are very friendly and open to hear suggestions and ideas on how to continuously improve. It's not uncommon to meet people who have been working for AvalonBay for 20+ years.
cons: Sometimes it gets tiring working Saturdays but that is just the nature of the beast. Don't let that discourage you from working here.

title: "Do what you love and you'll never work a day in your life"
pros: Working for Avalon over the past 6 years has been a wonderful experience. Coming from retails before this, I had low expectations but was pleasantly surprised. I'm not one to hop around from career to career only having the two in my lifetime, but I don't want to picture doing anything else. You have to like people to do this day in and day out. Yes there will be challenges, upsets and disappointment but getting to work with the people on AVB makes it all worth it. You get through it together and are able to celebrate the positives and learn from the negatives or mistakes together. I've been given the honor of growing with this company, being here since I was 22 years old. Growing as a person but also as a manager. A company that gives their employees this opportunity has all their employees best interests at heart.
cons: Systems and networks are a bit lacking. We rely on our computer systems to do our jobs on a daily basis, but when they freeze or don't talk to each other it can make a simple task seem almost impossible. As I mentioned before the company really cares about their employees., however I feel that can be to a fault. I've found struggling employees sometimes get too many chances, no one wants to see someone asked to leave a job or removed from a certain position but if things are dragged out or being slipped under the rug, it only hurts the team and property more.

title: Great place to work (***Software Engineers - Digital***)
pros: For software engineers: AVB is investing heavily in digital technology. We are developing new digital solutions enabling software engineers to be creative and innovative. We are cloud-native development on AWS and mostly serverless. It is a perfect green field environment for intermediate and senior engineers and tech leaders to be part of and build a career. General: - Great work-life balance - Most inclusive work environment - Excellent company culture and core values. People are fantastic - Leadership listens to associate feedback and diligently follows up to take tangible actions.
cons: Hard to think of any cons when you love what you do!

title: Limited Growth Opportunities
pros: AvalonBay recruits great people. Their leasing offices are well staffed with people who provide exceptional customer service, but above all else, every office has a great team.
cons: Very limited opportunities for growth. Do not accept an entry level position with an expectation to rise in ranks quickly. AvalonBay does not have many openings for positions of skilled labor.

title: not a serious career
pros: apartment discounts, meeting awesome people.
cons: They do not pay you enough to live comfortably in the area. The largest problem, they cap your commission..the more you lease and make them money, the less they pay you...literally. It doesn't make any sense. You will lease a $3000 apartment, but if you have already hit your goal, the commission drops down to about $5-$15 for that lease. Even getting promoted doesn't get you to 6 figures, and you have to be working there for years to get to management unless you make some serious connections with the very higher-ups. They literally prevent you from making money, even if you are a top performer.

title: Great Company with Caring Leadership
pros: The support that you receive as Manager with Avalonbay is fantastic. The off-site teams that support the revenue management processes, human resource and operational support are both intelligent and caring. Many companies preach work-life balance however this company practices what they preach by putting trust in their onsite team and are consistantly looking for ways to steamline processes that would inhibit customer service. I feel honored to work for this Avalonbay and encourage others that are looking for a hospitable culture and pro-associate enviroment join this team.
cons: I wish there were locations in Hawaii

title: Concierge
pros: Some of the tenants are lovely.
cons: No Security guards to protect the overnight workers just in case anything happens. When I initially started Avalon rented to nice respectable working families regardless of ethnic background which is cool. However in my third year and third supervisor / manager Avalon began letting all types of people into the building. As long as you can pay. It didn't matter what you did or the type of person you were. (ie: respectful.)

title: Bottom of the barrel management and execs
pros: No pros to list as of these days with new management and old management at one point had a spine and took care of the workers but now they don’t.
cons: Too many cons to list, one of them being pay is dismal, room for improvement to move up in the company is almost non existent. Turn over is rampant. Management is is a 2 out of 10, being forced to work outside of your job description is pretty much forced upon. A new neighbor pilot now has us working at other properties and not getting paid for our time and travel. When a company actively looks for loops holes to benefit for themselves, it’s bad for us workers.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: There is lots of room for advancement at the CCC. The atmosphere is also great. The people are nice and we have a wonderful culture. The site is big on employee engagement and you can tell by the Culture Committee and Spirit of Caring Committee.
cons: The CCC does a lot with employee engagement in the office. I wish the site had something once a year at the office that involved our families. Like a cookout in the parking lot where we could bring our family that would include a site tour. That would be my only small con.

title: Great company to kick-start a professional career!
pros: Generous company-paid lunches: Management team gets company credit cards and loves to feed us! Some weeks I hardly spend anything on food because there is always food in the break-room. Vendors often drop by with treats as well. Benefits package: I have never been disappointed with coverage from Blue Cross/Blue Shield. So far so good. Most employees accrue a day or two of sick time and vacation time per pay period. Paid holidays and compensation days provided. Spirit of caring: The only company I’ve worked for that truly does care. Plenty of food drives, collaboration with Hopelink, volunteer opportunities with pay, blood drives, pet adoption events, etc. Open-minded to individuals wanting industry change: For the most part management is willing to listen to where you are coming from and where you want to go. They are genuinely interested in exploring new ideas from outside experience/different backgrounds. Less political problems than other companies: Most of the management teams are easy-going and avoid drama. You don’t hear a lot of work gossip, at least at my property/region. Ever-evolving:
cons: tant changes to pay structure and operations based on both consumer and employee feedback. You can tell the company wants to improve. Takes employees’ ideas into consideration: Quarterly employee surveys to gauge interest and concerns.

title: Opportunity For Career Advancement
pros: If you're looking for a company to build a career, AvalonBay is a great choice. You're not going to be handed the opportunity, so you've got to show your worth, but there are so many examples in the company of associates earning multiple promotions across different departments. Also, the amount of time/money/resources AvalonBay gives back to the community through their Spirit of Caring initiatives will make you proud to tell people you work here.
cons: If you're looking for the latest in terms of technology, AvalonBay would not be your first choice. This is an opportunity for the company that is being addressed currently.

title: Constant Micromanaging and Incompetent Managers
pros: 401K, Health Insurance.....that's about it.
cons: tant Micromanaging and Incompetent Managers

title: Some good- poor opportunity to grow internally
pros: -ton of health,investment and vision benefits. - lots of software programs and policies in place to keep the product consistent. -
cons: - promotions recently were not based off of ability or results rather if someone interviewed well. - difficulty to transfer to a location that worked better for your personal life. Direct report never told regional manager or asked permission either, just made a personal decision.

title: Growth company where you can make a difference
pros: The size of the company offers the opportunity for everyone to really make a difference, unlike other very large companies where you can get lost among other employees. AvalonBay is a growth company which in and of itself creates excitement and momentum. You feel you are part of something bigger than your job
cons: Sometimes decision making can be overly analytical, but the quality of decision making is proof that it might be worth it.

title: honestly the best company iv ever worked with!!!
pros: This company does so much research in every aspect of its day to day works! I have been in this business for over 12 years, and AvalonBay has blown my mind the way they are with not only our residents but their employees! My team is amazing, I love coming to work everyday!!!
cons: ummmmmmm.............I really have none!!! I have never been happier with any company!

title: Excellent company, great benefits and excellent cultural
pros: Great benefits really, good pay and It’s a great company with great values.
cons: The pay could be better and the housing benefits for their employees could be a lot bette. We are in a new era so there should definitely be more flexibility with being able to work from home.

title: Nice working environment, but work/life balance is just not there
pros: The workplace seems to understand that employee morale is a factor in retention.
cons: It is very difficult to work a schedule between 9am-5pm, which is odd for the industry. The unfortunate part for the workplace culture is that most people enjoy the things the company provides, such as having contests and giveaways, but seems to pretend to be happy working there. Very few people seem to genuinely enjoy working there. The career opportunities seem to be mostly lateral.

title: Hard work means nothing.
pros: Entry level pay is okay and they love to feed you.
cons: They tell you to prove yourself and you can possibly get a spot on day shift. However people who don't produce but who are "liked" seem to get those slots. While others who literally need day shift are told they can't change shifts due to the business need. They never give bonus checks on time. They fire most of the good quality people too. The turnover rate is crazy. Raises shouldn't be based on classes.

title: Lots of growth opportunity, excellent corporate culture.
pros: I briefly made the mistake of leaving the company in search of opportunities that I thought would help to accelerate my career at a faster pace, but quickly saw that the grass was definitely not greener on the other side. I was fortunate enough to have an opportunity to come back to the AvalonBay team and could not be happier that I did. This is a company that truly cares about their associates and doesn't just talk the talk when it comes to our core values and cultural norms. There is a positive, can-do attitude that is prevalent throughout the organization. Feedback is taken seriously and actual change is implemented when it is the right thing to do. AvalonBay offers a work environment where associates are empowered to do the right thing, are supported to be successful in their role, and also to have fun while doing it. There is enormous growth opportunity and whether you are looking to move up or just gain a new experience in a different department, you can absolutely be in the driver’s seat of your career here if you want it.
cons: As the organization is large and has so many resources, sometimes it can feel that different departments aren't working towards the same goal. Again, this eventually gets corrected through associate survey feedback, etc. Also, because the company is very selective about who we bring on board, the interview process can feel long. My advice for those who are going through the recruiting process: be patient - it's worth it!

title: AvalonBay Communities is a great company
pros: The culture at AvalonBay is exemplified by management and demonstrated across the company at all levels. The culture is one that encourages continuous improvement, a spirit of caring, and a commitment to integrity. AvalonBay associates are committed to the company and to our residents. The company offers opportunities for growth and encourages promotion from within. AvalonBay is simply a great place to work.
cons: Fast paced nature of the company, which is a pro, can result in short deadlines and more work than can be reasonably accomplished within a typical 40-hour work week.

title: Best professional decision
pros: AvalonBay puts its Associates first when making business decisions. There is constant support from senior management and collaboration across departments. I am asked regularly if there are any projects I want to assist with or initiatives I want to participate in which keeps me challenged and always learning. By far the best company I have worked for in my career.
cons: No place is perfect! AvalonBay is staffed lean which means there is a lot of work to be done with, at times, minimal resources. However Management is always open to suggestions for improving the way we operate.

title: Lack Luster Compensation Plan & Autonomy
pros: There are plenty of benefits with AvalonBay. The company culture and core values are strong and respectable. Business is conducted ethically, making AvalonBay a company you can speak proudly about working for. The fringe benefits are a nice touch, but not a selling feature. Throughout 2020, the company grew its internal commitment to inclusion and diversity with an expansion of new resource groups. The most substantial perk is the vacation accrual increase the longer you are with the company; this is a core reason why I am still with the company. The on-site teams you work with make all the difference in the world. If I weren’t for them becoming a work family the associate turnover would be higher than it already is.
cons: I will omit the 2020 COVID-19 response from my review, other than to say the expectations of employees showed the company’s true colors for associate appreciation. At the end of 2020, each associate was given a Challenge Coin and $100 as a “Thank You.” Excuse me for being ungrateful, but it was a slap in the face from the VP executive team and above after the year we all endured. Not familiar with a Challenge Coin? Lookup how many Donald Trump had displayed in his office. The emotional value meant nothing to the on-site teams who received them since they are handed out like candy. Compare this to countless other property management companies who awarded their associates a minimum of $1,000 each. Staying on the topic of financial recognition and compensation, this is the greatest area of opportunity for associate satisfaction. Approximately every year or two, AvalonBay conducts an Associate Perspective Survey to solicit direct feedback. While this is a commendable gesture to do the right thing, there have been zero questions asked about compensation over the years, yet it is the highest written in response year over year. As an adult well out of college years it is embarrassing that a company in the housing industry does not pay their associates enough to live on-site at the communities they help keep occupied. Living paycheck to paycheck should not be a reality of the people who run the success of their business day to day. You are expected to achieve more with less resources and tools, staffing levels are a joke. It is hard to watch the on-site Managers work magic to achieve success while burning themselves out. Work life balance is non-existent and quarterly performance-based compensation is not paid timely. In the last year, the quarterly bonus for Supervisors and Managers (both office and maintenance) was paid late 3 times, once being 3 pay periods (6 weeks) late. Also, do not get used to the compensation plan because it changes (for the worse) every year. They like to pretend you have the autonomy to do your job and make decisions independently, but I have seen my manager be told outright a person of higher position can out rule their decision "because they can." AvalonBay, it is time for YOU to act like the owners and show the same commitment and dedication to your staff as your on-site associates do for residents, vendors, and peers. They are the reason residents ultimately chose to call AvalonBay home after all.

title: Excellent Company
pros: - They care about their staff - Very diverse workforce - Amazing opportunities for growing and developing your skillset - Work hard but have a lot of fun with organizational actives
cons: Not many cons. I would say if you are not a hard-worker and are a negative person then this may not be the best place for you. But if you are a hard worker and willing to learn you will love the company and make new family/friendships that will last a lifetime.

title: Great people and great company
pros: The people I work with are fantastic. Very smart, dedicated and friendly. The work is interesting and engaging. The company and senior management cares about its associates - more than just lip service. Senior management is top notch. I have full faith in the direction of the company.
cons: We use Lotus Notes instead of Microsoft Office! We'll likely move off Notes within the next 3-4 years but that will be a painful process. Information can be heavily siloed here and good information exchange can be lacking sometimes.

title: Good company, plenty of room for personal growth
pros: Great people, good managers, great company culture, excellent life-work balance, plenty of overtime(in my dept at least), good benefits (incl tuition reimbursement!), once you are situated there is opportunity to work in other depts if desired.
cons: LONG hours, crushing workloads, meager pay increases, quite a few disorganized/inefficient workflow processes, sometimes difficult deadlines to meet.

title: It went from great to ok to bad to terrible
pros: My co workers are the only thing that keeps me
cons: Pay is not competitive. Work load is too much. Company pretends to care about employees but they do not.

title: Great Leaders, Great Benefits, Pay Scale Needs Improvement
pros: Work/life balance is great. I'm not answering questions on my days off. Leadership is great. If you luck out and work at a decent property, you're more than likely going to have quality managers. Paid Emergency Time Off!! This was huge in the early stages of the pandemic and having this was absolutely fantastic.
cons: You will not be paid well for the hardships that you endure. If you know your worth, stick to it. Because they will not negotiate pay increases.

title: Good company room for imporvement
pros: the culture of the company is nice, and in most cases you can tell that they car.

I feel as though they could've offered extra compensation for those working onsite who had to interact with residents that would not comply with CDC guidelines or the policies that we put in place.

title: Should have switched to Avalon 30 years ago
pros: The superintendents have the authority to act as the owner. There is no waiting around for the owners to make a decision as you are encouraged to make the decision yourself based on what is good for the company overall. Since AVB is the developer, owner and contractor you have the power to push the project without waiting for decisions. AVB near the top in compensation and the bonuses are paid quarterly. It is extremely rare not to meet the criteria for your bonus. Lots of work in the Baltimore area.
cons: They only build apartments communities.

title: AvalonBay: Great people & a great place to work!
pros: -The people & culture here are awesome. Its great to work in an environment where you genuinely like the people you work with. Everyone is extremely hardworking and always willing to lend a helping hand. The supervisors are very focused on job growth and getting you where you need to be to move up in your position. -There are lots of opportunities to try new things and explore different facets of the company which always keeps things interesting. -There is a lot of promoting from within which is encouraging to see. -My supervisors aren't super strict when it comes to an exact time to be in every day as long as I'm getting my work done and not missing meetings. Our office is pretty relaxed but still gets things done. Everyone is very flexible with taking time off, taking off for a bit during the day for personal reasons, etc. -I always look forward to coming to work. My job here challenges me and is always making me push forward which I find very valuable. -The vacation time policy is pretty good. 2 weeks starting out and then after 4 years it goes to 3 weeks and then there are more days as your tenure increases from there. -The corporate offices have all been pretty dated and they have recently been moving and upgrading all of the offices. It may not seem like much - but its nice to come in to a shiny new office instead of one stuck in the 90s. -The rent discount is pretty good (20% off market) if you want to live at a community. And most of our community are pretty awesome (new or recently renovated) so that is a huge bonus.
cons: -Technology - people still use Lotus Notes? But after a week you are used to it. They have released new tools like Chatter (almost like a Twitter just for the company) which is new and exciting and our virtual magazine is cool. -Avalon doesn't pay super well - and its something they don't seem afraid to tell people. When you have your review and they tell you they don't give raises (base raise) based on the cost of living and if you live at a community they are most likely raising your rent more than you are getting in a raise - something doesn't add up there...Its really about finding the right balance between enjoying where you work, having a flexible schedule and opportunity for growth. Another company may pay more, but you may not find the same culture there that you have here. Hourly corporate associates are pretty much the only people in the company that aren't eligible for bonuses which is frustrating for many people. However, the fact that they tend to promote from within and really value their associates offsets some of these frustrations and makes you work harder towards getting to that next level. -The maternity leave policy isn't awesome - 6 weeks and they force you to use all of your vacation days...but if you can afford to take more time off, it seems they are very open to that and will work with you.

title: Property management reality
pros: Opportunities to grow if you have the right manager that enjoys seeing their employees grow, decent pay, housing discount, great company events.
cons: Policies vary from property to property depending on who is managing. Many associates know the policies and procedures better than managers do. Some managers lock themselves in their offices all day and do not contribute to the team.

title: Growing company with management issues
pros: Great people and atmosphere. There is much potential to become a great place to work but they need to get rid of the managers that kill the spirit of valuable employees and who do not align with the new core values. There is a 60 day waiting period for benefits but the benefits are decent. Flex time is a waste if you do not have children. There focus on innovation but so many processes are manually handled. Lotus notes is the worst! Technology is not important to AVB. Its more of lets have dedicated team of five people do it before we invest in the technology that can streamline the process and make it easier for everyone involved.
cons: - I will say the experience at AVB varies directly on your department and management. - No work life balance. Getting time off is next to impossible. (AVB operates on very lean workforce) - lack of professional development and support from management - little to nothing raises once a year. I think its just the cost of living and no more or less. - the 401k match is once a year in January. - autonomous work environment; departments have overlapping initiatives and the same is true within the departments - the right doesn't know what the left is doing. - corporate has a huge disconnect from on-site employees.

title: Worst Company Ever!

title: Community Consultant

title: Excellent Company

cons: IT. Unfortunately, outdated technology. But, they are updating. Bet on them to be cutting edge in technology soon! If you're looking to make a difference, IT here is the place to be as the opportunities are limitless. This company does nothing half-way.

pros: Schedule . No pay because they make you work a lot and the pay is not worth it I looking for something else now

title: Maintenance

title: Potentiometer and Leadership
pros: The people you get to meet, learn, mentor, grow and built personal and professional relationships with!

title: Amazing Company with Great Learning Opportunities!
pros: There are too many pros to list. The corporate office in Arlington, VA is a wonderful place to work - new and modern. The leadership allows so much growth for associates and the resources for growth are wonderful. I would highly recommend considering AvalonBay for employment. Their initiatives on I&D are a priority, and the ability to get involved and build connections is great!
cons: The only con was the hiring process was a bit longer at AvalonBay than other organizations I was considering. Although - not necessary a con as it ensures thoroughness in hiring.

title: Started well, ended ugly.

He made up a policy violation, lied about it being reoccurring. JW Boston. Keep that in mind. There isn’t many people who stay past 3 years, and it’s the shady practices from the 22nd floor of the Federal Reserve Building in South Boston that are the reason. Making 30% more and the stress is so much less. Grass is definitely greener with this company.

title: Excellent Place to Work - Wonderful Culture
pros: AvalonBay has a very special and unique culture and it's what sets us apart from other organizations. This is also why you'll find such long tenure with associates across all departments. The people you work with on a daily basis are some of the brightest and nicest people you will meet, and are always supporting you every step of the way. After all, we are here for the same purpose: "Creating a better way to live". While working at AvalonBay you will also have access to a plethora of great benefits that are offered: In-person and web based training, Health and Wellness Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision), Flexible Spending Accounts, Paid Time off, 401(k) with Company Match, LTD/STD, Tuition Reimbursements, Scholarship Opportunities for you and/or your children and Stock Purchase Plans to name a few. Among the many benefits that are offered you will also experience and live one of our main core values which is A Spirit of Caring - A genuine kindness and concern for others. We associates, have a strong belief in our Philanthropy Program and dedicate an entire month which is called "Spirit of Caring Month". This is a special time for AvalonBay to give back in the communities and regions we operate in. It also allows another opportunity for associates to come together and give back to others. I can't say enough great things about working here!
cons: While I don't have any cons that come to mind - I will note that technology has been an area of focus for the company and improvements have been made since I've started with the organization back in 2013.

title: A company with heart, a vision to create great environment for employees and residents!
pros: The regional management team in Northern California is caring and experienced (a couple directors have over 15 years with Avalon Bay). They create an environment of openness and accessibility that is refreshing and encouraging. I really, really like the local people on the maintenance and sales/management teams on our property. We've had a couple meaningful team-building meetings during the past year that's helped create connections of care and respect. It's a pleasure to come to work each day knowing that my day will be filled with pleasant interactions with my team as we work together serving our residents. The training for new hires is extensive and excellent. The training director in our region is a dynamo of energy and encouragement. The training events early in my employment created opportunities to meet other employees in similar roles and build relationships. The company also provides seasonal events for all employees in our region where several hundred team members gather for awards, fun, and food. The management appreciates the local staff people and it shows through these kinds of events. Some properties take Sunday off. That is definitely a positive factor in creating work/life balance. I get one day at home for family activities and another weekday for personal projects and appointments. People stay with this company - our property's maintenance manager has been here 19 years! Other maintenance staff have been at this property for 8 and 15 years. That is phenomenal - these people are pros and the company has taken care of them in a way to keep them happy! I have seen lots of people promoted over the past year! Four people on our local management team were promoted to positions with more responsibility (and they all deserved it!). Their replacements were all internal company moves filled by well-qualified people. Nice to see upward mobility for those seeking to move their careers forward! The company is large enough to be investing in innovation and improvements to the properties and our work tools. A new software application has contributed to making postings to Craigslist almost automatic. It was tested in two regions first, so the roll-out was smooth and well-planned. The benefits are great. The vision plan (VSP) is generous, new frames and lenses each year! It's easy to get a day off at my property because we have a large staff. After a year here, I haven't had a vacation day request denied.
cons: After listing all the positive things above, anything I could add to this section is petty in comparison! There is always room for improvement but there's also hope that consideration will be given when appropriate. I think the company pays about on par with the industry. It would be nice if wages were on the higher side of the scale. Even with all the positive aspects of working for Avalon Bay, I still have to consider how to make the most money for my family with my work hours.

title: Amazing people that are always willing to help
pros: It all starts with the people I work with; they are like a 2nd family. Everyone is willing to help and works together to ensure the communities are successful. With the right work ethic and being flexible, you have plenty of opportunities to advance or even transfer to different departments. Great benefits, PTO, holiday schedules, and discounted stock in the company. Overall, I truly enjoy working for AvalonBay and with all my co-workers.
cons: Fairly recent change in housing benefits for on-site associates that's subpar to our competitors.

title: The leaders of the company demonstrate the values we were taught: Integrity, Caring,Continuous Improvement
pros: This is a "make it happen" company that won't be boxed in. I learned a lot, gave a lot, and made some friends for life.
cons: Worked many, many hours - needed additional head count to sustain pace of growth and improvements.

title: Sales Manager
pros: Associate empowerment, concern for employees well being, extensive training, Company name is awesome leverage on your resume. Very easy to feel apart of a team effort, investment in a long term career. You are always in the know about company progression and performance.
cons: It's about who you know, not pure talent. Associate advancement is mapped out months in advance, so if you are not on the current road map your turn will pass. If you are not a suck up, promotions may not come as easy.

title: Great company with great benefits
pros: This is a top notch company to work for with great benefits. There are quarterly awards, usually at a fun event such as a baseball game, where employees are recognized for their outstanding work. The other plus are the great co-workers because everybody really gets along which makes the day more enjoyable.
cons: I haven't run into any cons yet, but I would like to mention that the company is working on streamlining systems to make it more user-friendly for their employees.

title: I have worked for AvalonBay for over 18 years because they let me know that I matter.

Associates at every level are accessible and enthusiastic about sharing their knowledge in order to enrich your career. They are also equally willing to request feedback, good or bad in order to continuosly improve.

title: Great environment! Decent Pay

title: Mixed Reviews
pros: Decent employee culture, good training on various software systems & most people are great to work with. Everyday is different & interesting.
cons: Lots of politics when it comes to internal promotions. Favoritism is alive and well. Hourly pay lowered this year by 12% for new Bonus Structure which was disappointing.

title: Good company, great culture

cons: No glaring cons, so anything I list would be very nit-picky, probably not worth mentioning anything at all.

title: AvalonBay is the best company I have ever worked for in my 20+ year career in property management.

They go above and beyond in efforts to listen to all feedback from associates and continuously strive to improve. The companies vision and future is communicated and kept alive daily. The high level of talent in every department is amazing and drives incredible results.
cons: I honestly don't have a single con. I love working for AVB and am proud to be associated with the company.

title: Great company, but culture is changing

title: Great Culture.

cons: The bonus structure lacks the transparency that initially existed. For internal candidates, qualifications should be considered more in salary decisions, especially when switching markets, as you end up with associates that are not paid as well as the those who enter the company as new hires or even those with "lesser" titles.

title: Lots of Room for Improvement...
pros: - People are decent - Benefits are good - bonuses are good - volunteer opportunities are fun and enriching - offices are nice
cons: - many employees are hard to work with and you will carry their weight - management is spread very thin so prepare to deal with escalations on your own - residents differ depending on the complex, but are commonly unreasonable and will berate you for any reason - they launched a new plan called "neighborhood" where instead of working at one place, you have to "help out" other communities multiple times a week. -This has failed at many communities, many, many other employees hate it, and it makes residents angry for not knowing who to reach out to, and they will take it out on you. - bonuses are nice but hourly pay is very low (most consultants cannot afford the apartments they are selling) - many long-term employees are trapped because they got apartments when the price was low and with the discount they can't afford to leave and are now stuck working for the company. - workload is intense and demanding

title: Love the culture here

title: Exceptionally Great Place To Work

Family oriented from working to living environment. Promote growth from within. Continuously improving to promote a spirit of caring and safety.

cons: - Long hours (9:30 - 6:30) - "Targeted Salary" in offer letter is slightly misleading - The bonus structure is unclear Again I love the people I work with... but long hours and salary are two big factors that kept the rating lower.

title: This Company is Both Owner & GC
pros: The company is both the owner and GC, this reduces frustration with endless paperwork formality. The company is generous with snacks, food, drinks, etc... The diversity of employee's is really good, especially for the industry. There are many great mentors with years of experience that are willing to teach.
cons: The work-life balance is the biggest issue. Although not "required" you will find yourself working 10+ hours per day (plus Occasional Saturdays).

title: Proactive not reactive
pros: Ever since I started with Avalonbay I've been able to clearly see the path given to me. Management is very open, honest and trustworthy. They provide you with the tools you need to succeed as well as the guidance to coach your peers.
cons: The only con I could possibly give would be staffing. I would like to see a more thorough look into new hires and their skill sets. To set yourself apart from the rest you must provide nothing but the best.

title: Maintenance Supervisor
pros: The residents and my co-workers are the reason why I love working at Avalon Bay. Avalon offers competitive wages. My co-workers have great work ethics and really care about the residents.
cons: My supervisor is fair and tells everyone what there expectations are. He is non-threatening when he corrects me. He helps lift people's self-esteem, yet gets his message across."

title: Great place to work

I appreciate that if I have contrary suggestions or new ideas they're taken seriously and have the ability to implemented. I hope to continue calling AvalonBay home for many more years to come.

title: Meaningful Work

cons: There are no downsides I can think of.

title: Sr. Maintenance Manager

title: Slow and Steady
